trans-unit.source: Operations on Stored Procedures
trans-unit.target: Operations on Stored Procedures

trans-unit.source: A stored procedure is a piece of application logic written in JavaScript that is registered and executed against a collection as a single transaction.
trans-unit.target: A stored procedure is a piece of application logic written in JavaScript that is registered and executed against a collection as a single transaction.

trans-unit.source: In DocumentDB, JavaScript is hosted in the same memory space as the database.
trans-unit.target: In DocumentDB, JavaScript is hosted in the same memory space as the database.

trans-unit.source: Hence, requests made within stored procedures execute in the same scope of a database session.
trans-unit.target: Hence, requests made within stored procedures execute in the same scope of a database session.

trans-unit.source: This enables DocumentDB to guarantee ACID for all operations that are part of a single stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: This enables DocumentDB to guarantee ACID for all operations that are part of a single stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: The stored procedure resource is represented by <legacyBold><parameterReference>sprocs</parameterReference></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The stored procedure resource is represented by <legacyBold><parameterReference>sprocs</parameterReference></legacyBold> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The stored procedure resource has a fixed schema.
trans-unit.target: The stored procedure resource has a fixed schema.

trans-unit.source: The body property contains the application logic.
trans-unit.target: The body property contains the application logic.

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: Merely having <parameterReference>All access mode</parameterReference> for a particular stored procedure does not allow the user to execute the stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: Merely having <parameterReference>All access mode</parameterReference> for a particular stored procedure does not allow the user to execute the stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: Instead, the user has to have <parameterReference>All access mode</parameterReference> at the collection level in order to execute a stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: Instead, the user has to have <parameterReference>All access mode</parameterReference> at the collection level in order to execute a stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique name used to identify the stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique name used to identify the stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: body
trans-unit.target: body

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: This is the body of the stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: This is the body of the stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the stored procedure resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the stored procedure resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: Stored procedures can use the DocumentDB JavaScript Server-side SDK to make database operations like create, read, update, delete and query documents, as well as read from the request body and write to the response body of the stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: Stored procedures can use the DocumentDB JavaScript Server-side SDK to make database operations like create, read, update, delete and query documents, as well as read from the request body and write to the response body of the stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: For more details, refer to the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB server-side SDK documentation</linkText><linkUri>http://dl.windowsazure.com/documentDB/jsserverdocs/</linkUri></externalLink> and the server <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB side programming tutorial</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more details, refer to the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB server-side SDK documentation</linkText><linkUri>http://dl.windowsazure.com/documentDB/jsserverdocs/</linkUri></externalLink> and the server <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB side programming tutorial</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.target: The following are the allowable operation on stored procedures.

trans-unit.target: Create a stored procedure

trans-unit.target: Replace a stored procedure

trans-unit.target: List stored procedures

trans-unit.target: Delete a stored procedure

trans-unit.target: Query stored procedures

trans-unit.source: Execute a stored procedure
trans-unit.target: Execute a stored procedure

trans-unit.source: Aside from the execute operation, the rest of the REST operations are similar to the operations used on documents, as specified in <legacyLink xlink:href="9ee04fa0-e636-42ff-8ae5-e45975c0971f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on DocumentDB Documents</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: Aside from the execute operation, the rest of the REST operations are similar to the operations used on documents, as specified in <legacyLink xlink:href="9ee04fa0-e636-42ff-8ae5-e45975c0971f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on DocumentDB Documents</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>docs</legacyItalic></legacyBold>, they are preformed against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>sprocs</legacyItalic></legacyBold> resource path under a particular collection.
trans-unit.target: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>docs</legacyItalic></legacyBold>, they are preformed against the <legacyBold><legacyItalic>sprocs</legacyItalic></legacyBold> resource path under a particular collection.

trans-unit.source: Hence, we will not elaborate about each of the operations again here.
trans-unit.target: Hence, we will not elaborate about each of the operations again here.

trans-unit.source: For information on how stored procedures work, including execution of a stored procedure, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB programming: Stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how stored procedures work, including execution of a stored procedure, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB programming: Stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>.
